messageBody:
> That's an excellent use of the RunWith extension hook. It looks like
> it handles the problem floated in the thread called "Dynamically
> discovering classes in a package. (was: Re: [junit] Why is it
> considered an error if there is no test in the file?)". Would you
> agree that it does that?

I'd say yes.
a) It's specifically designed to detect test classes in the classpath
b) A class that has no test method won't be added to the suite

I'm currently playing around with options to search also for test
suites (classes annotated with @RunWith) in the classpath. I'll
probably release my experiments in the days to come.

Johannes
